column4: for some reason on my system monitor my swap memory and regular memory seem to be switched and my box is running sluggish is there a way to change the specs for memory, i havent done this in a long time so forgive me
sorry i was trying to ask on line but it switched to this
what is wrong? memory or the system monitor? all your memory isn't detected?
well the only clue as to why it running slow is when i look at the system monitor to see whats running my swap memory looks like it should be switched with user memory
hmm.. how can you tell? what are the numbers? or you are looking at the graphs?
user memory shows im using 125 of 218MB (57%) and swap says im using 35 of 1004 (4%)
i think it should be the other way around right
well.. do you have 1 GB of memory installed? or 218 MB?
i only have 351MB so it looks wierd to me, this only happened after i switched from ubuntu to Xubuntu
check the first page in the system monitor.. "system".. at that page there should be something about memory
oh.. using xubuntu... sorry.. don't know what the system monitor looks like there

I don't know why your memory isn't correctly detected.. I would expect to see 125MB of 320 MB user memory used.. don't know what could change that.. my computer has all it's memory available as user memory.
it says i only have 218MB so im going to take out the other stick since it may be bad
yea i did that yesterday it stalled
so i will do it again when i take out the new stick and see what happens thanks
you're welcome and good luck in getting that memory working
thank you, i really appreciate it
